subject: Re: Why my own TestListener implementation doesn't work?
msgSnippet: ... OK, get your meanning. Here is another question for you, I create my TestResult and use assign my TestResult to the TestResult used in run(TestResult
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> Tao,
>
> createResult() is somewhat confusing--it has nothing to do with the
> normal flow of JUnit execution. To do what you're doing, many people
> will override runTest().
>
> David Saff

OK, get your meanning.

Here is another question for you, I create my TestResult and use assign my TestResult to the TestResult used in run(TestResult result), I did see that my TestResult returns me whether a test fails, but it doesn't tell me in the tearDown after a test case finishes, instead I can check the error count and failure count changes in the setUp in the next test case.

This is really confusing me, why don't those count changes in tearDown()?

Thanks and regards!
Tao
